subject: assertEquals error message
msgSnippet: I m trying to find the right place to ask for a change to JUnit.  I hope this is it.  If not, please tell me where to go. :) In the current version of JUnit,
messageBody:
I'm trying to find the right place to ask for a change to JUnit. I hope
this is it. If not, please tell me where to go. :)

In the current version of JUnit, assertEquals displays an edited message
when it fails. This is very frustrating as it makes it difficult for me
to see the source of my errors.

For example, the below test displays this error:

The test:

public void testArrggghhh() {
assertEquals("foobar", "foo bar", "foobar");
}

Displays: "foobar expected: <... ...> but was <......>"

This error message is useless for me. I work around it, of course, but
it's making me go a lot slower. I would like to see this feature turned
off or made more sophisticated by the introduction of more surrounding
context (say, at least ten characters on each side). Any plans to fix
it?

Jim
